abstract.p: William H Vogt letter replies to Stephen S Roach's Sept 5 Op-Ed article opposing a big federal tax cut

block.p: Stephen S. Roach (''2 Candidates, 1 Plan: Spend the Surplus,'' Op-Ed, Sept. 5) thinks that a big tax cut is a bad way to use the large federal budget surplus. If it's a bad idea when we have a surplus, when would it be a good idea? Maybe he thinks that widespread tax cuts are to be avoided in any circumstances.

Stephen S. Roach (''2 Candidates, 1 Plan: Spend the Surplus,'' Op-Ed, Sept. 5) thinks that a big tax cut is a bad way to use the large federal budget surplus. If it's a bad idea when we have a surplus, when would it be a good idea? Maybe he thinks that widespread tax cuts are to be avoided in any circumstances.

Yet isn't it possible that a big tax cut, rather than leading to inflation, would ignite widespread investing by companies and individuals, leading to economic growth and counteracting the effects of the low personal savings rate that Mr. Roach so laments?
WILLIAM H. VOGT Gillette, N.J., Sept. 5, 2000
